results.title: The Goodies and the beanstalk
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jim Franklin, J.H. Davies and BBC
results.brief_description: They’ll do anything, anytime, anywhere - and they’ve got the bike to prove it. Here are three episodes of classic high-brow comedy starring Tim Brooke-Taylor, Bill Oddie and Graeme Garden. THE GOODIES AND THE BEANSTALK: Cricklewood, 1973: poverty stricken, the Goodies sell their tandem for a tin of beans - which, when planted, grows into a giant beanstalk leading up Mt Everest to the giant’s castle where golden eggs are laid. But before the Goodies can become rich, they must battle with the Giant. Note: this is the 43 minute Christmas version. Guest stars Michael Aspel. THE END: The office is entombed under a pillar of concrete in line with Graeme’s new city development plan. Isolated, the Goodies explore their relationships with each other, politics, religion and eye-spy. THE BUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. TEA ROOMS: The Goodies go west (well, Cornwall) to mine for gold, but strike cream instead. Graeme monopolises the cream business by sneaking off on the other two, but Tim and Bill also find strawberry jam and scones. The stakes are set for a poker game where winner takes all, and culminates in the Bunfight at the O.K. Tea Rooms.

results.title: The Goodfather
results.brief_description: Joe’s dad migrated to Australia when he was a young boy. His achievements in life are what Joe celebrates in this moving tribute to his dad.

results.title: The Goodbye girl
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Neil Simon’s fast-paced romance set in New York City revolves around the life of Paula McFadden (Marcia Mason) and her precocious daughter Lucy (Quinn Cummings). Recently abandoned by her boyfriend, Paula soon discovers that their apartment has been sublet to Elliot Garfield, a confident and self-obsessed actor from Chicago preparing for his New York debut (Richard Dreyfuss in an Academy Award performance). As Elliot arrives to claim the apartment the hate-at-first-sight pair strike an uneasy compromise that has explosive consequences.

results.title: The Good, the bad and the ugly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Alberto Grimaldi and Produzioni Europee Associati
results.brief_description: During the Civil War a mysterious nomad (Clint Eastwood) enters a macabre business partnership with a Mexican gunman (Eli Wallach), a man with a price on his head. Eastwood turns him in to the authorities, collects the reward money, and at the last minute, rescues him so that they can begin the whole process again. They make quite a good living doing this until they form an uneasy alliance with a sadistic criminal (Lee Van Cleef), and this time, the stakes are much higher. This film is the third and arguably the best of Sergio Leone’s westerns set during the Civil War. With a memorable score by Ennio Morricone and excellent cast, this is the quintessential “Spaghetti Western”.

results.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
results.creator_credit: United Artists, Constantin Film, PEA, Arturo González Producciones Cinematográficas S.A., Sergio Donati, Sergio Leone, Luciano Vincenzoni, Carlo Simi, Agenore Incrocci, Furio Scarpelli and Alberto Grimaldi
results.headline_credit: Germany, Italy, Spain and United States of America, 1966
results.brief_description: While the Civil War rages between the Union and the Confederacy, three men – a quiet loner, a ruthless hit man and a Mexican bandit – comb the American Southwest in search of a strongbox containing $200,000 in stolen gold.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

results.title: The Good, the bad and the noodley
results.brief_description: Business is booming for Ninja Noodle which means business is bad for The Grubby Gruel. After the noodle shop is raided by the town bad apple, the good Shinobi must battle against the odds to return his secret sauce to its rightful place. East meets west in a noodle-filled western caper.

results.title: The good, the bad and the animated
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. This animated homage to Sergio Leone has the classic western ‘shootout’, between a cowboy in black and a cowboy in white. This town ain’t big enough for the both of them.

results.title: The Good, good, good, good life
results.creator_credit: Rolf Forsberg, Karl Holtsnider and Teleketics
results.brief_description: This film serves as a plea for restraint and conservation in the use of goods and services, through the story of a self-sufficient retired man whose modern family deluge him with modern appliances, re-do his homely living room and attempt to introduce him to the “good life”.

results.title: The Good years of jazz
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films
results.brief_description: In the early 1960’s, the Goodyear tyre company comissioned five short jazz films, featuring a handful of the leading musicians of the day in a move that was not purely philanthropic, but which also acted as part of a promotional campaign.

results.title: The Good woman of Bangkok
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: This disturbing and controversial portrait of Aoi, a reluctant prostitute on the streets of Bangkok, is a very personal piece of work from filmmmaker Dennis O’Rourke. The soul of this young woman is captured as she shares her life story with the camera as much as with the filmmaker. O’Rourke picked her up in a bar and paid a pimp for her services. They stayed in a cheap motel in the red-light district. What proceeds to be laid bare, is a searing portrait of prostitution and the self-loathing that it helps breed.
